result.execSummary:
The defendant Bradley J Greiner was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Criminal Trespass to Dwelling [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.14.

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Must sign up for Probation by close of business tomorrow, November 3, 2015.

miscConds.notes:
$150.00 cash bond to be applied towards Court costs.
If probation or extended supervision is allowed to expire or is revoked with outstanding financial obligations, the supervising agent shall notify the court 10 days prior to the revocation or discharge and provide current financial information.  A civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for any balances due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect all debt.

Must complete an anger management assessment and comply with recommended follow-up treatment.
Must complete any and all evaluations, counseling, treatment and follow-up recommended by Probation Agent.

records.addlTxt: Does not plan to seek postconviction relief

Defendant Bradley J Greiner in court with attorney Frederick A Bechtold.  Angela Lynn Beranek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Plea agreement;   Guilty plea to count 2 with the domestic abuse enhancement;   Count 1 Dismissed and Read in.     The Court finds plea is knowingly, intelligently and voluntarily given and finds the defendant guilty.  Factual basis found.
